Definition: Man-in-the-Middle Attack - An attack where the attacker secretly intercepts and possibly alters the communication between two parties.
Financial Records - Data related to financial transactions, account statements, and other monetary activities.
Internal Memo - Internal communications within an organization, typically containing operational or administrative information.
Business Email Compromise - A form of cyber attack where the attacker gains access to a business email account and uses it to conduct fraudulent activities.
Legal Document - Documents related to legal agreements, contracts, and other legal matters.
Denial of Service Attack - An attack designed to overwhelm a system, making it unavailable to its intended users.
Spam Email - Unsolicited and often irrelevant or inappropriate messages sent over the internet, typically to a large number of users.
Phishing Email - Fraudulent attempts to obtain sensitive information by pretending to be a trustworthy entity in electronic communication.
Technical Support - Communications or documents related to technical assistance provided for software or hardware issues.
Malicious software designed to disrupt, damage, or gain unauthorized access to computer systems.
Social Media Post - Content posted on social media platforms, which may be benign or used in social engineering attacks.
Account Takeover - Unauthorized access and control of a userâ€™s online account by a malicious actor.
